intro: Decaptera trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves, which are divided into three lobes. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It has a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including mammals and insects. Decaptera trifida is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
